lines.text:
[McCloud is walking in the middle of the road with handcuffs on]
Trying to get killed, Mack?
I need a lift!
With those handcuffs? Good luck!
Look, I'm a peace officer, got a badge in my pocket.
Sure, and I got the Mets in my glove compartment.
The, eh, teargas blew, the witness flew and not a shot was fired.
Sounds like something you'd sing around a camp fire.
By golly, you're right. 'The Ballad of James Otis Waldron'.

Now look, Miss Coughlin, where I come from, we listen to Country & Western radio stations. But in between we get what they call news cast, where we primitives pick up on big city shucks like bestsellers and possible sale of movie rights.

[getting a drink in a limo]
We don't have too many mobile, eh, juice fixtures out our way.
I see you have the book.

[picks up Chris Coughlin's book]
Oh yeah, yeah, you betcha.
She mentions my name in it.
Stop by for your autograph.
What about McCloud?
McCloud? He couldn't find the Empire State Building on a clear day.
Okay with you if I keep an eye on him?
What for?
Because a fish out of water sometimes learns to crawl.
You're biological clock is three hours out of wack.
That's the first time I've ever heard it called that.
I'll come back when you're spring's all wound up.
We're just keeping tabs, in case you find a bobcat.
How are you, Marshal?
About even.

[facing a group of reporters]
Now you fellows are just too good at your jobs. What I'm trying to say is nothing, but you just keep pulling it out of me.

[about Broadhurst]
He's gonna be madder than a scolded owl.
Now you can close it up as tight as you want to, officially, but unofficially, and off the record and if you insist, off base, I'm in this to the bitter bottom dregs.
You might as well know that beauty contests are female karate.
I'm on to you, McCloud, you're a dirty old marshal.
I just want you to know how much I appreciate you having wrecked the sales of my book.
